title: AWS (Elastic Block Store)
description: In my time at AWS, I have spent time on the Developer Tools team and the Placement team (recommending where workflows should go in data centers). On the Developer Tools team, I worked on building a log retrieval system to reduce the time to investigate automated workflows by 90%. I also took over leading an org-wide migration that had been in the works for 6 years and brought it to completion, actively communicating with a variety of stakeholders and resolving countless unforeseen issues as they arose. Despite only being on the Placement team for a few months, I have already started working on projects to include historical data to make better informed decisions and shift from static constraints to dynamic ones that better reflect real-life situations. Between projects, I also enjoy building AI tooling to improve our team's productivity. I built a custom knowledge base at chat chatbot to answer team-specific questions, and I am currently building a code review agent to improve our code quality.
subtitle: 2024-Now | Python, Java, Kotlin, Cloud Development, AWS, Docker, Git, Distributed Systems

title: Analyzing Query Logs
description: For my intern project at Amazon, I was tasked with creating a pipeline to ingest query log data, process, analyze it, and present the results in a dashboard. I taught myself how to use a variety of AWS tools including S3, Athena and QuickSight using the Boto3 API. I also learned how to build a cloud development kit and work with Dockerfiles. While I gained a lot technical skills from this experience, I also gained countless professional ones. I learned to write maintainable code, communicate my progress concisely, present technical details to audiences with varying backgrounds, manage my time effectively and document my design and implementation choices. This was an extremely valuable experience for me and changed the way I code.
subtitle: 2023 | Python, Cloud Development, SQL, AWS, Docker, Git

title: Synthesizing Training Data
description: For my senior capstone project at Harvey Mudd College, I got the opportunity to work with healtcare technology company Inspiren. I worked as a Project Manager and Software Engineer on our team of four undergraduate students to develop a pipeline to synthesize domain specific training data for computer vision models. This was a challenging project because Inspiren works with patient data, so we had to develop methods to generate training data that improved model performance but also preserved patient privacy. We explored various techniques including deblurring models and privacy-preserving learning. I trained and tested several machine learning models and modified them to suit our data. I also developed a UI using PyQt to screen the results of our machine learning models. This project also taught me how lead a team, delegate tasks, provide progress updates to stakeholders and lead meetings. I also developed strong interpersonal skills through collaborative work sessions and pair programming.
subtitle: 2023-24 | Python, Machine Learning, PyTorch, AWS, Qt, Git

title: Finding Automorphisms
description: This was my first large scale project that I worked on. While researching the Automorphism Groups of Partially Ordered Sets (complicated math), I found that our team was spending a lot of time doing intensive computation by hand, so I created a Python script to do it for us. This script saved us a lot of time and the matrix transformation algorithm I used inspired new approaches to understanding partially ordered sets. However, I acknowledge that this is not very high quality code and if I were to redo this project with my skills now, it would look very different.
subtitle: 2022 | Python, Abstract Algebra Research

title: Variational Autoencoders
description: For my Neural Networks class, I recreated a Variational Autoencoder (VAE) with three other students. Our VAE was trained to generate images of cats.
subtitle: 2023 | Python, Generative AI, PyTorch

title: Meal Scheduling App
description: I often have a hard time deciding what I want to eat, so planning what I should meal prep is a very difficult task for me. To solve this problem, I built a simple app that consists of a web UI, a SQL database and a Python backend that picks meals and communicates them with Google Calendar. The app works by allowing the user input meals that they cook into a database. The Python backend then selects the meals for each week and creates a Google Calendar event with the meals for that week. This project taught me about full stack development, how to break down a problem into separate parts and design a solution.
subtitle: 2024 | Python, SQL, Google Cloud API, Flask, JS, HTML, CSS

title: Analyzing Gaze Locations
description: I took a class in Human Vision to understand how people view world and inform approaches to CS developments. As part of the class, I got the opportunity to conduct eye-tracking experiments on how quickly people are able to differentiate between human faces and synthetically generated ones. This is one of the scripts I wrote to analyze that data.
subtitle: 2023 | Python

title: Analyzing My Spotify
description: I like knowing what I have been listening to and often use third-party tools to keep track of my Spotify. So, I decided to try out the Spotify API and do some of my own analysis.
subtitle: 2023 | Python, Spotify API

title: My Personal Website
description: I have taught myself all of my Web Development skills by doing various personal projects. This website was my way of teaching myself React. Although I could have built most of this website in CSS and HTML, I decided to challenge myself to do it all in React. I learned how to create responsive pages and animations, use hooks, and factor code into components. I also got to put my design skills to the test.
subtitle: 2024 | React
